THE TWIN TOWERS OF CENTURY CITY
EXT. SKY VIEW OF L.A. BY NIGHT
CUERVO JONES, UTOPIA AND THE OTHERS
THE DOCTOR, THE SURGEON GENERAL OF BEVERLY HILLS
AS MAP TO THE STARS EDDIE
A SIGN ABOVE A CONCRETE BUNKER
THE FRONT EDGE OF THE TSUNAMI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A hot summer's day. Heat ripples distorts the towering sh buildings in the dense smog.

dialogues.speaker: FEMALE NARRATOR
dialogues.text: An earthquake measuring 9.6 on the Richter scale hits at 12:59 p.m., August 23rd, in the year 2000.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly we are hit by the loudest, booming, rolling conc you have ever heard. The buildings begin to shake, swayin The Bonaventure Hotel implodes, collapses inward in the t slamming freight train of an earthquake. The 4-level Inte as the Santa Monica Freeway shatters, crumbles, pulling e ramps, cars, trees, and nearby buildings with it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Buildings shaking. Streets buckling. Cars rolling, crashi People running. Gas mains exploding. Buildings convulsing dropping like tinder against an inferno.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the tsunami sweeps in from the ocean, smacking into th shoreline like the hammer of God, plunging us into darkne

dialogues.speaker: FEMALE NARRATOR
dialogues.text: After the devastation, the constitution is damned, and the newly elected President accepts a lifetime term of office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of the United States. A line tracks along the Mexican bor the Berlin Wall.

dialogues.speaker: FEMALE NARRATOR
dialogues.text: Fearing a massive terrorist invasion from South America, the United States prepares for war. The Great Wall is built along the southern border, cutting off the flow of illegal aliens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ruins of L.A. Rubble, smoke, a lethal wasteland. An a terrifying figures climbs atop a mountain of debris. They their weapons into the night sky.

dialogues.speaker: FEMALE NARRATOR
dialogues.text: Street gangs, South American terrorists and the criminally insane capture Los Angeles, the once-great City of Angels.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An unrecognizable L.A. After the big one. Surrounded by w L.A. is now an island off the new western shore, tilting edge of the continental plate.

dialogues.speaker: FEMALE NARRATOR
dialogues.text: Now an island on the border of civilization, L.A. is a no-man's land of chaos, anarchy and darkness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A red line tracks along the mountainous areas surrounding island, defining the perimeter of the armed fortress. Pol firebases and gun emplacements are indicated in the San G Mountains.

dialogues.speaker: FEMALE NARRATOR
dialogues.text: The United States Police Force, like an army, is encamped in the San Gabriel Mountains.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From the glowing, outlined canyons come the cries of rage million lost souls.

dialogues.speaker: FEMALE NARRATOR
dialogues.text: The President's first act as Permanent Commander-in-Chief is Directive 17: protect and defend the United States from this island of the damned, Hell on Earth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TRAVELING SHOT low, across the top of the water's surface up the side of a massive, rusted supertanker, abandoned, ago. Break over the railing to reveal a gigantic neon sig screams "NEW LAS VEGAS." The supertanker has been transfo a floating resort.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The camera increases speed, moves past huge billboards di gigantic glitzy ads:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "NUCLEAR NIGHTS IN HAVANA" - an extravaganza with fabulou showgirls and laser recreations of Fidel's final night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "MUSEUM OF NIGHT CLUB ARTS" - a virtual reality tour feat legendary Vegas entertainers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "FREE ENTERPRISE WORLD" - a virtual Disneyland for the wh family.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now camera flies low through glittering streets and back filled with gamblers, neon and glitz.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An alley strangled with tourists, gamblers, hookers, hust con men - professional expatriates from the West mingling excited visitors from all over the world.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A Salesman with a chin-mike speaks non-stop, unintelligib Chinese. A frenzied crowd gathers around him, waving mone placing bets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two men sit at either end of a long table. They are in de shadows, facing each other. We only get glimpses of them: Mirrored sunglasses. Chinese. His fingers tap on the tabl cockroach scurries past. Ammo belts. A sheathed combat kn size of your arm. .45 automatics in holsters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The other, dressed in black. An eye-patch. Dangerous. A f two six-guns in holsters. A futuristic gunfighter. The co dashes past his fingers. WHAP! He squashes it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The crowd goes nuts, placing bets, yelling and screaming dozen languages.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The salesman places three different shaped, clear shot gl front of the two men. Then he leans over to...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A VAT OF POISONOUS SNAKES. He reaches in, grabs a cobra, out. The cobra hisses and squirms. Deftly, the salesman c to talk non-stop into his chin-mike as he milks the cobra into the first glass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pulls out an ice-pick, jabs it into the snake's throat bleeds a thick green-white liquid into the second glass. he slits open the cobra with a large knife, and cuts out and liver. Tossing aside the dead snake, the salesman squ heart and liver with his fingers. The juice drips into th glass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now the salesman stirs the glasses. The poison is clear. is milky-green. The heart and liver are red. He places th on the table between the two men.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two men stare at each other, motionless. The crowd co placing bets at a fevered pitch. A titanium white tube fl above the center of the table. A laser beam of light shin one end.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The salesman leans over and flicks on side with his finge sending the tube spinning on its axis like a bottle, the circling the room before stopping on the fat man's forehe

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The fat man reaches slowly toward the glasses. His hand s slightly. He hesitates. Finally he takes the glass with t liquid (the heart and liver), lifts it to his lips, pause gulps it down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The crowd explodes. More bets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The salesman leans over and spins the light tube again, t it lands on something black, an eye-patch. Pull back to r man with an eye-patch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The man with the eye-patch reaches forward, his hand paus between the remaining two glasses. He takes the one fille milky-green blood and downs it fast. The crowd roars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One glass left. The two men stare at it intently.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The salesman spins the light tube with more force than be circles again and again, slowing down, speeding up, final stopping on the fat man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The salesman begins yelling over the din of the crowd, sh the fat man. The fat man reaches for the glass of clear p His trembling fingers hover above it. Then he quickly wit his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The crowd reacts, boos, as...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The man with the eye-patch smiles. A slightly, cynical sm without hesitation, he reaches out, grabs the glass of po drinks it down. The crowd surges forward, but the salesma them with a sweep of his arm. All bets are off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two men stand from the table. Take several steps away the end of the alley. Stand facing each other. Two gunfig

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Flashes of the two men. A piece of a black military boot. positioned over a six-shooter. Mirrored sunglasses. A swe trembling lip. And the eye-patched man's one good eye, bl clear, staring - hard and calm as a sunny day...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The draw. It happens in an instant. The alley thunders wi gunfire. The guns buck and flash. Then silence. The two m there for a beat, until one of them, the fat man, slumps, face first into the alley, dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The crowd goes completely ape shit as SNAKE PLISSKEN emer the shadows of the alley, holsters his guns, grabs his ta money...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SNAKE PLISSKEN. Long hair. A black eye-patch. A tight-lip grimace. The impression of coiled aggression and intense The toughest, most dangerous man on planet earth. A legen

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PLISSKEN strolls out of the alley into the crowd. He coun money, pockets it, as a cigarette girl approaches him. PL stops her, pays for a pack of cigs. As she eyes him...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... the cigarette girl touches him, pricks his skin with fingernail. A drop of blood appears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PLISSKEN turns, stares after her, as the sound of helicop rises from above in the night sky. The crowd suddenly sta disperse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Helicopter searchlights blast down on the street. PLISSKE suddenly caught in the glare. He starts to move away...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Out of the blackness above a huge steel net drops out of The net slams down on top of PLISSKEN, trapping him, driv down to the pavement with its weight... PLISSKEN struggle the net as black figures - United States Police Force Off rush toward him, grab the net, tightening it. More cops m him as we SLOWLY FADE TO BLACK...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Searchlights sweep down across a column of policemen marc a concrete wall. Camera begins to crane up the wall. Soun roaring turbines. The howl of the Santa Ana wind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Camera reaches the top of the wall. Armed police troops s the battlements. Across what looks like an ocean is L.A. is from the Newhall Pass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hidden by the Santa Monica Mountains, L.A. glows in the d with a hundred fires. Smoke surges from the jagged horizo the sky is an angry orange.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Res sensor lights glow in evenly spaced intervals. Search sweep into the darkness. Cannons are in place every 200 f manned by police guards.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Water stretches into blackness. This was once the San Fer Valley, but now it's all underwater. Pieces of debris - t buildings, the tail of an airplane, a radio tower - stick the surface. We can make out the letters of an old, half- sign: "SAN FERNANDO VALLEY MALL"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The wall stretches to the northwest up to the Santa Susan Portions of the 118 Freeway arch up out of the water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Firebase Seven is a fortified base camp in the San Gabrie Mountains. It is a sprawling police complex with low conc bunkers, gun emplacements, satellite communications, vehi troops, the works. ON A LARGE ASPHALT FIELD, opposite the complex is Rotor City - row after row of black, multi-bla totally evil police battle helicopters parked like giant the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A throng of policemen gather at the edge of Rotor City ye cheering, their fists in the air. Cops with camcorders vi the event. A police anchor reports...

dialogues.speaker: POLICE ANCHOR
dialogues.text: He's been the Force's Most Wanted Man for 10 years. Convicted of 27 moral crimes. I can tell you, the excitement around here is... (a great roaring skyward) Here he comes!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A MASSIVE 7-ROTORED, 40-BLADED HELICOPTER TRANSPORT comes down out of the black sky and lands. The growing crowd of cops goes nuts like fans at a football game. They slap ha dance wildly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A mammoth room filled with high-tech instrumentation. A g holographic map of L.A. fills one wall. Most of the contr personnel have left their work stations and gather around all showing the Police Channel: a view of the helicopter sitting on the asphalt and the cheering crowds at the edg Rotor City.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A tall, steel-faced officer sits at his desk. This is Fir Commander MAC "BIG DOG" MALLOY. Hard, battle weary featur BRAZEN, a section Lieutenant, comes up.

dialogues.speaker: BRAZEN
dialogues.text: Commander Malloy. They're bringing him out, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Malloy rises from his chair, steps to a nearby TV set, wa scene from the Police Channel.

dialogues.speaker: MALLOY
dialogues.text: So we finally got him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The crowd of cops is growing to a frenzy of wild anticipa

dialogues.speaker: POLICE ANCHOR
dialogues.text: Hold one! The door is opening!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door of the helicopter transport slowly lowers like a drawbridge. Out of its black belly comes...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SNAKE PLISSKEN. A steel collar is clamped around his neck lengths of chain stretch to eight armed guards who escort down the ramp. Plissken is bruised, badly beaten and tort face a mess, but he doesn't seem to care. A line of battl cops stand with their guns aimed right at Plissken's head marched into camp. An army of camcorders move ahead of th Anchor as he scampers along in front of PLISSKEN, intervi him.

dialogues.speaker: POLICE ANCHOR
dialogues.text: Hello, Plissken. Welcome to L.A.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Celebrating cops cheer as Plissken is lead to...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bunker has one large opening, into which hundreds of march. Guards in towers monitor the condemned as they tru of fenced-in containment areas, down walled corridors to bunker entrance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The deportees are minorities, the poor, prostitutes, pimp thieves, adulterers, atheists - the Morally Guilty, outca society. Single mothers carry babies. Teenage runaways hu together. There are abortion doctors, drug dealers, porno the prisoners of a massive cultural war.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Plissken is marched toward the entrance, a loudspeaker out:

dialogues.speaker: POLICE VOICE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: You are now entering the Deportation Center. You have been found guilty of moral crimes against the United States of America.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A great cheer goes up from the cops as the Police Anchor his interview...

dialogues.speaker: POLICE ANCHOR
dialogues.text: S.D. Bob Plissken. Special Forces, Black Light, Texas Thunder. Two Purple Hearts. Youngest man ever decorated by the President.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Plissken's face remains so impassive as to be almost blan

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A glowing, vaporous-orange corridor. More cops gather to Plissken as he is escorted into the bowels of the Deporta Center.

dialogues.speaker: POLICE ANCHOR
dialogues.text: You've been convicted of 27 moral crimes, Plissken. The murder of an Internal Revenue agent. The kidnapping of a bank president. Gun fighting for profit. The list goes on and on...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Deeper into the Deportation Center. Camera tracks along t deportees, some bleeding, some wrapped in rags. Plissken, Police Anchor, camcorders and the armed escort move throu dark, low concrete passageway.

dialogues.speaker: POLICE ANCHOR
dialogues.text: You used to respect the law. Served your country like no man before you. Role model to a generation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Police Anchor leans in as close as he dares to Plissk face.

dialogues.speaker: POLICE ANCHOR
dialogues.text: What happened to you, war hero? You were the best we had.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steel walls. Deeper into the Deportation Center. The depo here are in worse shape. Some appear to be dead. Plissken entourage continue along, as the speaker echoes a pre-rec message...

dialogues.speaker: POLICE VOICE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: You are sentenced to permanent expulsion beyond the borders of the U.S. You now have the option to repent of your sins and be electrocuted on the premises. If you elect this option, notify the Cleric Sergeant in your Processing Area.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Plissken and his entourage pass deportees kneeling and pr front of cloaked cleric cops, government holy men. Beyond opened doorways, see Death Row deportees being strapped i futuristic electric chairs.

dialogues.speaker: POLICE ANCHOR
dialogues.text: The whole world's watching. Every good and decent person who works and hard and follows the rules. What would say to them?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Plissken's expression is blank.

dialogues.speaker: POLICE ANCHOR
dialogues.text: What would you say to all of us who believed in you, who looked up to you, who thought you stood for right over wrong, good over evil? Be my guest. What do you have to say, Plissken?

dialogues.speaker: PLISSKEN
dialogues.text: (beat) Call me Snake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guards move Plissken through a doorway, and the huge doors slam shut on the Police Anchor and the camcorders.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Malloy, Brazen, and a 3rd man, tall, charismatic, grim, m urgently along a corridor.

dialogues.speaker: BRAZEN
dialogues.text: ComStat did a psychosearch on him. Used a database of 5 million sociopathic personalities. He hit the bottom of the curve.

dialogues.speaker: MALLOY
dialogues.text: Perfect for the mission. Nobody else can pull it off - not an army, not a man.

dialogues.speaker: BRAZEN
dialogues.text: Zero emotional developments. Total lack of compassion. A highly developed psychopathic instinct to survive.

dialogues.speaker: 3RD MAN
dialogues.text: Let's get this over with.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cell door slams shut. Plissken turns around. Writ and irons. He looks around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the concrete cell he sees a simple table with an overh above it. A watch lies on the table. Plissken shuffles ov up the watch, examines it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cell door opens. Malloy, Brazen, and the 3rd Man ente room unarmed. The door closes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Malloy and Brazen move forward, to the edge of the light. Man stays back in the shadows by the door.

dialogues.speaker: MALLOY
dialogues.text: How you doin' Plissken? (no reply) You like the watch?

dialogues.speaker: PLISSKEN
dialogues.text: You assholes didn't bring me here to give me this for 20 years of dedicated service. What'ya want?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Malloy looks back to the 3rd Man in the shadows...

dialogues.speaker: 3RD MAN
dialogues.text: Get to it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Malloy raises a control unit, pushes the button. The ligh down and a computer-enhanced image appears on the wall...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From the point of view of a surveillance camera. The lab Banks of processors, disk drives, test bays, prototype as areas. High tech. A group of government officials is bein tour. Utopia, 17, the President's daughter is among them. virginal, she wears a "True Love Waits" button on her flo dress.

dialogues.speaker: MALLOY
dialogues.text: At 1030 hours Wednesday, a group of government officials began a tour of the Livermore Defense Lab. The President's daughter, Utopia, was among them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Plissken continues to watch the image on the wall...

dialogues.speaker: MALLOY
dialogues.text: An hour later, she boarded Air Force 3 to Washington.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The 3rd Man reacts as the image in front of Plissken chan

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From the point of view of a camcorder. Utopia stands insi main cabin of a plush, government 747. In one hand she ho black anodized box the size of a transistor radio with a top. In the other, a machine gun.

dialogues.speaker: UTOPIA
dialogues.text: (to the camcorder) To the American people - it is time to rise up and demand the surrender of the President and his corrupt theocracy of lies and terror.

dialogues.speaker: MALLOY
dialogues.text: At 1140 hours, she hijacked the plane. We scanned the videotape on VR. Check it out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Inside the surveillance room the President stares grimly presses a button. Suddenly the image in front of Plissken out all around him. He is in a virtual reality re-creatio

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Plissken stands manacled in the main cabin. A group of se service men and congressmen watch as a flight attendance a camcorder. He's videotaping Utopia as she rants into th She's pent up with such anxiety she's like a panther in a

dialogues.speaker: UTOPIA
dialogues.text: Today is Day One of a brand new world. The days of the empire are finished. (beat) To the President - my father, you know what this is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She holds up the anodized box with the red button and thr at the camcorder.

dialogues.speaker: UTOPIA
dialogues.text: You know what it will do. Unless you abdicate your throne by tomorrow night, I will use it - on you.

dialogues.speaker: CONGRESSMAN
dialogues.text: Utopia, please. Give us the prototype. If something should happen -

dialogues.speaker: UTOPIA
dialogues.text: It will be in my hands - and the hands of my lover.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She says "lover" with all the drama a 17-year-old virgin muster. The others are shocked.

dialogues.speaker: UTOPIA
dialogues.text: Yes, my lover. My man. The only real man I've ever known. I'm on my way to his arms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She moves to the rear of the main cabin, bends down, open hatch in the floor, scrambles down...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHAM! The VR image suddenly disappears and Plissken is ag standing inside the concrete cell. Malloy and Brazen stan front of him.

dialogues.speaker: MALLOY
dialogues.text: Somehow during the tour, she came into possession of a prototype transmitting device. We don't know how.

dialogues.speaker: BRAZEN
dialogues.text: Utopia became depressed after her mother's suicide, began to withdraw into her virtual reality simulator. She'd punch up her own little world in cyberspace and stay in it for days at a time. (hits a button) Somebody else was in there with her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In front of Plissken: A computer-rendered VR picture of c sunshine, green grass and happy animals frolicking. A Gar Eden. There, coming toward us, is CUERVO JONES. South Ame terrorist. Fiercest warrior of the Third World. He wears gleaming ancient Aztec battle helmet. Bandoliers strapped him.

dialogues.speaker: MALLOY
dialogues.text: Cuervo Jones. Shining Path. Peruvian terrorist. Runs the biggest baddest gang in L.A.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cuervo Jones takes off the helmet He is blindingly handso charismatic. He smiles, reaches out his arms to camera as embrace it. The image suddenly pops back to the beginning on a loop. The image disappears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The lights in the cell come up.

dialogues.speaker: BRAZEN
dialogues.text: Utopia made tapes of her VR experiences, then tried to erase them. She missed this fragment on the end of her last tape. Cuervo Jones must have tapped into the VR master data bank - and then went prowling around for innocent blood, someone vulnerable to corrupt. Utopia was lonely, looking for something to believe in.

dialogues.speaker: PLISSKEN
dialogues.text: Sad story. You got a cigarette?

dialogues.speaker: MALLOY
dialogues.text: Shut up, Plissken.

dialogues.speaker: PLISSKEN
dialogues.text: What's the little black box do?

dialogues.speaker: MALLOY
dialogues.text: Top secret. Only on a need to know.

dialogues.speaker: PLISSKEN
dialogues.text: And I don't need to know. So fuck you, I'm goin' to Hollywood.

dialogues.speaker: MALLOY
dialogues.text: That's right, big shot. Unless you do what we want you're not coming back.

dialogues.speaker: PLISSKEN
dialogues.text: So what's the deal, huh? Go into L.A., find the President's daughter, secure the box, and bring 'em both out - and I'm free?

dialogues.speaker: MALLOY
dialogues.text: That's the deal.

dialogues.speaker: PLISSKEN
dialogues.text: Tell the President to adopt. I think I'll like L.A.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After a couple of beats, the 3rd Man appears next to Mall Brazen. He stares at Plissken for a moment, holds up some

dialogues.speaker: 3RD MAN
dialogues.text: If you bring out the prototype, you'll receive a full pardon for every immoral act you have ever committed in the United States. Just like in '97. Remember New York, Plissken?

dialogues.speaker: PLISSKEN
dialogues.text: (looks at him) Who are you?

dialogues.speaker: MALLOY
dialogues.text: It's the President, for Christ's sake!

dialogues.speaker: PRESIDENT
dialogues.text: I give you my word. Put the prototype into my hands, and you're a free man.

dialogues.speaker: PLISSKEN
dialogues.text: I can see you're real concerned about your daughter.

dialogues.speaker: PRESIDENT
dialogues.text: Utopia is lost to me. My daughter is gone.

dialogues.speaker: PLISSKEN
dialogues.text: Well, I'll think it over.

dialogues.speaker: PRESIDENT
dialogues.text: You're running out of time.

dialogues.speaker: PLISSKEN
dialogues.text: I've been doin' that all my life. Might as well do it in L.A. Everybody else there is.

dialogues.speaker: MALLOY
dialogues.text: Well, enjoy it, war hero, cause you got 10 hours to live.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Malloy, Brazen, and the President turn to leave...

dialogues.speaker: PLISSKEN
dialogues.text: Wait a minute, what are you talkin' about?

dialogues.speaker: MALLOY
dialogues.text: Having second thoughts?

dialogues.speaker: PLISSKEN
dialogues.text: Maybe. But you're not putting any shit in me this time.

dialogues.speaker: MALLOY
dialogues.text: You don't understand. It's already in you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As an image of the cigarette girl in New Las Vegas flashe suddenly. Her fingernail scratches his arm. He tightens.

dialogues.speaker: MALLOY
dialogues.text: The cigarette girl in New Vegas was an undercover cop. She injected you with incentive toxin. Right now it's swimming in your bloodstream. It'll start to take effect in 9 hours.

dialogues.speaker: BRAZEN
dialogues.text: It's a strain of the Plutoxin 7 virus. Genetically engineered. 100% pure death. Complete nervous system shutdown. You crash and bleed out like a stuck pig. Not a pretty sight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Plissken takes a step toward him. Malloy holds up a large hypodermic.

dialogues.speaker: MALLOY
dialogues.text: Of course there's an anti-toxin. Neutralizes the virus immediately upon injection. (beat) We'll give it to you, but you have to do us this little favor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and then Plissken attacks the President, hurls himself the room, throwing the chain around the President's neck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Plissken passes right through the President, causing his waver slightly, then falls on his ass.

dialogues.speaker: PRESIDENT
dialogues.text: Didn't think we were that stupid, did you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The real Malloy, Brazen, and President stand in front of camera in a small room offering a view of the cell throug transparent portion of the wall.

dialogues.speaker: MALLOY
dialogues.text: We're holographs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Plissken stares at the three images in front of him, then camera lens on the wall...

dialogues.speaker: PLISSKEN
dialogues.text: Get this crap out of me.

dialogues.speaker: MALLOY
dialogues.text: I guess we have a deal. Nice to be working with you, Plissken.

dialogues.speaker: PLISSKEN
dialogues.text: (beat) Call me Snake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Plissken checks through various tactical survival items a weapons laid out on a table. Brazen watches as Malloy sho high tech submachine gun.

dialogues.speaker: BRAZEN
dialogues.text: Very sweet little weapon. Core burner. Magnesium ammo. 500 extra rounds. (moves on) Two 9mm handguns. (holds up a silver pill) Oral projectile. Mouth dart. Hold it in your mouth for ten seconds, the coating dissolves, it becomes a weapon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Malloy breaks open the silver pill. Inside is s small, le looking dart.

dialogues.speaker: BRAZEN
dialogues.text: Urolite. It'll stun the enemy for several seconds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Plissken picks up a small, computerized compass.

dialogues.speaker: MALLOY
dialogues.text: Tracer. Utopia has a kidnap chip implanted in her arm. You can locate her with this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brazen hands Plissken a large black clip.

dialogues.speaker: BRAZEN
dialogues.text: This clips right onto your 9mm. Ammo enhancers. Like miniaturized grenades. Blows through anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Plissken snaps the clip onto his pistol, then unsnaps it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Plissken suits up. Submachine gun, handguns, six-guns. He and Malloy walk quickly across the complex.

dialogues.speaker: MALLOY
dialogues.text: L.A. is in a constant state of warfare. Gangs fighting for the right to rule.

dialogues.speaker: BRAZEN
dialogues.text: Heavy Third World connections. They get weapons, drugs, fuel, choppers - everything is pumped into the island from the south.

dialogues.speaker: MALLOY
dialogues.text: Some areas have power - they're on line to San Onofre.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Brazen's command helicopter takes off...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Plissken stares at a photo of the anodized prototype.

dialogues.speaker: PLISSKEN
dialogues.text: I'll need to know more about this thing.

dialogues.speaker: MALLOY
dialogues.text: Only a handful of people are aware of its existence. Let's just say it's the ultimate defensive weapon.

dialogues.speaker: PLISSKEN
dialogues.text: Defense against what?

dialogues.speaker: MALLOY
dialogues.text: There's a war about to be declared, or didn't you know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Plissken shrugs.

dialogues.speaker: MALLOY
dialogues.text: Third World wants to live like we do - and they plan on taking what they want. The Cubans and Brazilians are ready to invade Miami. If the Africans and Colombians make a run at the border, we got a full scale attack on the United States.

dialogues.speaker: PLISSKEN
dialogues.text: So what does this thing do?

dialogues.speaker: MALLOY
dialogues.text: All you need to know is get it back here by 5 a.m.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Command helicopter lands near a large access tunnel i containment wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Plissken, Brazen and Malloy walk through the dark, dank t Armed guards stand at the ready. A hatch in the tunnel fl stands open. A ladder disappears down into the darkness.

dialogues.speaker: MALLOY
dialogues.text: (points to the open hatch) You're going over by submarine. One-man submersible. Nuclear powered.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Plissken arranges his gear, climbs into the hatch opening

dialogues.speaker: PLISSKEN
dialogues.text: Where do I put ashore?

dialogues.speaker: MALLOY
dialogues.text: Cahuenga Pass. Make your way up through the mountains toward the Hollywood Bowl. You should be able to pick up Utopia's tracer there. (beat) Once you go inside, you're on your own. (beat) You know what you have to do with the girl, don't you? (beat) We have to spare this nation her trial - for treason.

dialogues.speaker: PLISSKEN
dialogues.text: So you want me to take her out? (Malloy nods) Is that an order from the President?

dialogues.speaker: MALLOY
dialogues.text: Let's just say it's what's best for the country.

dialogues.speaker: PLISSKEN
dialogues.text: By the way - who gives me the anti-toxin?

dialogues.speaker: MALLOY
dialogues.text: A medical team will be standing by.

dialogues.speaker: PLISSKEN
dialogues.text: Not you?

dialogues.speaker: MALLOY
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: PLISSKEN
dialogues.text: Good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KABLAMM! He fires, ripping hellish blasts at Malloy. Ther damage. Malloy laughs.

dialogues.speaker: MALLOY
dialogues.text: Thought you might try that. First clip is filled with blanks. Goodbye, Plissken.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Malloy kicks the hatch and it slams down on top of Plissk Brazen pushes a control button, sealing it shut.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Plissken climbs down the ladder into a small submarine ba him on a launching rig is a sleek, black one-man submarin like a dart. The submarine's hatch is open. Plissken clim inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Plissken seals the hatch behind him. He has to lie flat o stomach to operate the sub. He quickly hits various switc buttons, powering up the cockpit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Malloy and Brazen move to a surveillance-command post.

dialogues.speaker: PLISSKEN, (V.O. RADIO)
dialogues.text: Com check.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Malloy picks up the microphone.

dialogues.speaker: MALLOY
dialogues.text: I'm here, Plissken.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Plissken looks at the wrist watch. It ticks down ominousl hours and counting down...

dialogues.speaker: MALLOY, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Stand by for launch. Ignitor. (Plissken pushes a button) Fuel rod injection.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Plissken pulls a lever, watches his dials. A deep humming grows louder inside the sub.

dialogues.speaker: PLISSKEN
dialogues.text: She's in the green.

dialogues.speaker: MALLOY, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Lock fuel rods.

dialogues.speaker: PLISSKEN
dialogues.text: (hits a switch) Locked.

dialogues.speaker: MALLOY, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Nuclear turbine to 75% power.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Plissken turns a throttle-like control with his left hand

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Out of the rear tubes of Plissken's sub comes a roaring b

dialogues.speaker: PLISSKEN
dialogues.text: 75% power.

dialogues.speaker: MALLOY, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Hands on switches and counting. 5...4...3...2...1. Launch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The rear tubes roar. Suddenly the sub is shot forward thr long, circular tunnel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Plissken braces himself as the cabin lurches, vibrates wi force.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A door in the wall opens, revealing the circulator tunnel roaring explosion, the sub rockets out of the tunnel, sho the wall like a cannonball. The submarine is airborne for seconds, then drops down, and slams into the San Fernando

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Plissken is rocked with the impact. He guides the sub wit controls. In front of him on a screen is a schematic diag the underwater landscape of the San Fernando Valley.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the underwater darkness, see the broken remains of the Freeway, as the subs creams past, its nuclear wake churni water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Malloy, Brazen and other cops follow Plissken's course on gigantic computer screen.

dialogues.speaker: MALLOY
dialogues.text: Plissken, watch your speed. Lots of obstructions down there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the sub rockets past the ruins of the Van Nuys City Ha barely missing it.

dialogues.speaker: MALLOY, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Plissken...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Plissken ignores him, carefully maneuvering the sub with controls.

dialogues.speaker: MALLOY, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Plissken... do you copy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Camera follows the sub as it streaks along just above the submerged ruins of the Ventura Freeway. See the ghostly s cars, trucks, busses below, smashed and overturned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They watch the sub, a red blip on the screen, move along freeway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Plissken twists his hand throttle, pouring on the power t

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EXT. VENTURA & HOLLYWOOD FREEWAY INTERCHANGE - UNDERW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sub rips through the water, faster and faster, goes i hard bank to the right as the Ventura Freeway turns into Hollywood. A sign at the edge of the Hollywood Freeway re "SPEED LIMIT 55". The sub screams past.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brazen points to a readout showing the submarine's engine

dialogues.speaker: BRAZEN
dialogues.text: His reactor's starting to overheat.

dialogues.speaker: MALLOY
dialogues.text: Plissken, slow down the sub. You're overloading the power plant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Plissken glances at the gauge. His nuclear turbine readou moving to yellow, into red. He pushes it up to 102%.

dialogues.speaker: MALLOY, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Plissken...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Plissken's eye turns back to the computer map in front of the screen: the red blip representing the sub is headed r toward a building. Plissken pulls hard on the controls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sub smacks into the side of the Black Tower, powers t it, blasts out the other side through a window, tilting a wobbling. The sub rights itself momentarily but is slamme downward out of frame by a huge, dark, slimy object.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KING KONG looms overhead - his fist rising and falling wi currents. Plissken has maneuvered himself into the wrecka Universal Studios Tour.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sub zips through the King Kong ride into Back To The passing 1950's signage from that film, dodging a rusting It slams into the open mouth of JAWS, shattering the mode million pieces.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sub continues on, bouncing through the narrow opening Earthquake Ride - broken pipes, cracked sidewalks, split hard to tell what was the ride and what was The Big One.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Plissken hangs on, as small jets of water spray into the through tiny cracks in the hull.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sub suddenly tips upward, rising for the surface.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sub explodes out of the water, lands belly first on a with a hard thump.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Plissken presses the hatch controls. The sub begins to sl backwards down toward the water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Plissken struggles, then rips open the hatch, scrambles o sub slowly slips backwards, down into the water. As the r exhaust tubes hit the surface, a blast of steam. Plissken out of the hatch. The sub sinks faster and faster. He sca the side, leaps for ground... and lands on the hillside, sub sinks into the sea, bubbling, churning, hissing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A bleeping sound. He takes out his pocket walkie, raises antenna.

dialogues.speaker: MALLOY, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Plissken...?

dialogues.speaker: PLISSKEN
dialogues.text: I'm here.

dialogues.speaker: MALLOY, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Where's the submarine? It's disappeared off our screens.

dialogues.speaker: PLISSKEN
dialogues.text: It's history. I gotta go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Plissken clicks off the walkie, pockets it, turns to clim hillside when...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHAM! Standing above him is a dark figure. Hooded. Carryi something huge and rounded at the ends.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Plissken raises his submachine gun...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... as PIPELINE steps closer. He's a surfer in a black we Carries a surfboard. A rifle is slung across his shoulder Pipeline's face is raw, burned - too many hours surfing i

dialogues.speaker: PIPELINE
dialogues.text: Too bad about your boat, man. (Plissken doesn't move) Supposed to be some swells out here tonight. Big ones. (beat) You like to surf?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Realizing Pipeline is no danger, Plissken moves past him hillside.

dialogues.speaker: PIPELINE
dialogues.text: You look kinda familiar. (beat) You hang out around here much?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Plissken's moved off into the darkness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Plissken reaches old Mulholland Drive, now dark and desol Shells of houses stand nearby, black and empty. It has be rain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sound of gunfire. Plissken ducks behind a tree...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two old cars come zooming up Mulholland, side by side. Wi down. Guns blazing at each other. They pass Plissken, con down Mulholland, ripping each other apart with gunfire. P darts across Mulholland, down the mountainside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The rain pours down as Plissken makes his way down a stee incline.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CRACK! A dark figure steps out from behind a tree. Plissk submachine gun ready. It's Pipeline.

dialogues.speaker: PIPELINE
dialogues.text: Hey, man. I know who you are. You're Snake Plissken. Man, I can't believe you're really here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: More gunfire from above on Mulholland...

dialogues.speaker: PIPELINE
dialogues.text: Kind of a bad neighborhood, Snake.

dialogues.speaker: PLISSKEN
dialogues.text: Which way to the Hollywood Bowl?

dialogues.speaker: PIPELINE
dialogues.text: (points) Down that way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Plissken starts down.

dialogues.speaker: PIPELINE
dialogues.text: Be careful. Some real strange dudes hangin' out there these days.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Plissken continues moving, now just a blurry figure in th

dialogues.speaker: PIPELINE
dialogues.text: Hey Snake - what're you doin' around here, man? (as Plissken disappears) I heard they busted you up real good in Cleveland...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The rain is coming down in a torrent as Plissken makes hi down the hillside. Then, all at once, the rain lets up, t stops. The trees drip with moisture. Suddenly, a huge KAT above him. Plissken looks back. A huge mudslide is roarin down the hill toward him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Plissken races down the hill, but the mudslide cascades d like a freight train, catches up with him, sweeps him off feet... and Plissken goes riding down the hill, rumbling sliding in the mud.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The mudslide hits a flat area near a stand of trees, spre slows. A completely mud-covered, black Plissken climbs ou goo. He's dripping with it. His one good eye shines in th moonlight. He takes a couple steps toward the edge of the when...

dialogues.speaker: A VOICE, (SPINAL)
dialogues.text: Shut-up, fuck! Stop makin' noise!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Plissken spins. He's standing right next to SPINAL, the l the Black Cowboy Gang. Dressed in black, boots with spurs duster, black cowboy hat, he carries an automatic rifle. just like Charles Barkley.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Plissken looks around, realizes he's in the middle of a s of Black Cowboys, crouched behind the trees, waiting in a Covered with mud, Plissken blends right in.

dialogues.speaker: SPINAL
dialogues.text: Take cover, fool.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Plissken jumps behind a tree, looks down the hillside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Below his position is the Hollywood Bowl. A huge cross is stage, and the cross is on fire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A group of white hooded men, the K.K.K., stand in front o burning cross holding a ceremony. Next to the cross on st hooded K.K.K. string quartet begins playing a Hayden conc

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Plissken reacts.

dialogues.speaker: SPINAL
dialogues.text: Let's take him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A Black Cowboy raises his M79 grenade launcher, as the ot quickly race down the hillside. He fires.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A 40mm armor-piercing grenade leaves a blazing fire trail rockets toward the burning cross and - KABLAMMO! A fireba pieces of the cross into the air. The K.K.K. spin around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A blast of lightning illuminates the Black Cowboys attack the hills. They open fire. A K.K.K. Grand Dragon is picke feet, buffeted in mid-air, flesh and robe shredded by gun hail of bullets hits the K.K.K. They return fire, but are overwhelmed. They are hit, jerking and twisting. Fire fro Black Cowboys is withering, racking the hooded figures li of lightning. The Black Cowboys keep advancing, firing, a starts to rain again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Through the cloudy wash of dribbling rain water, the fire continues. Four K.K.K. leap out from behind a row of seat jump Plissken, knocking his gun to the ground. In a blind flash, using hands, feet, and head, Plissken sends them f he reaches down to pick up his submachine gun, he sees th rain is washing the mud off his body...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AND SO DOES SPINAL, who stands nearby, watching as Plissk washed clean by the rain. Spinal raises his weapon, then

dialogues.speaker: SPINAL
dialogues.text: Hey. I know you. Snake Plissken.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Plissken slowly stands, his submachine gun in his hand. B them, the firefight is almost over. The K.K.K. scatter in rain...

dialogues.speaker: SPINAL
dialogues.text: Hey, what's going down, Snake?

dialogues.speaker: PLISSKEN
dialogues.text: I'm looking for somebody.

dialogues.speaker: SPINAL
dialogues.text: Who ain't?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Plissken pulls out his tracer. It is blipping red, just s the Bowl.

dialogues.speaker: SPINAL
dialogues.text: Say, is it true what they say about Cleveland, man?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Plissken doesn't answer. He moves on through the rain...

dialogues.speaker: SPINAL
dialogues.text: Later, Snake. Thanks for the help. You can always shift down and mojo with us anytime.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ruins of the Capital Records building. The rain has s again. Plissken is a lone figure walking along the street distance, the sound of thumping music.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pandemonium! Music blares. It's the old Supremes hit, "Lo Like An Itchin' In My Heart." Crowds dance in the street. like a block party. Black, Latino and Native American gan celebrate. Plus the usual Hollywood Boulevard street traf Plissken moves through the carnival. Gorgeous hookers sta the marquee of the ruined Chinese Theater. The marquee no

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One of the hookers struts in front of Plissken.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Opening her mouth, she gives a sensuous puff. A polypropy orifice attached to the inside of her lips expands outwar small, pink balloon. She sucks it back in and puckers, ki air. Plissken turns, as the sounds of car engines rises.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... is a caravan of vehicles. The crowd parts to let them cheering insanely. Plissken ducks into an alley, watches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The caravan passes Plissken's position. Two men on horseb a convoy of rumbling, fuming old cars, buses, motorcycles scarred and ripped and jerry-rigged - bumps down the Boul

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Plissken watches from his spot in the alley, as a blonde- hooker joins him, rubs his arm. She has no polypropylene, none that we can see.

dialogues.speaker: BLONDE HOOKER
dialogues.text: It's winnin' time, baby. How about you and I do some celebrating?

dialogues.speaker: PLISSKEN
dialogues.text: What's going on?

dialogues.speaker: BLONDE HOOKER
dialogues.text: You must be new around here. (beat) You look familiar. Have I done you before?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Plissken grabs the hooker.

dialogues.speaker: PLISSKEN
dialogues.text: What's happening?

dialogues.speaker: BLONDE HOOKER
dialogues.text: Easy, man, easy. It's Cuervo Jones' gang. Mescalito Justice. He's the big boss man 'round here tonight. (whispers) He's gonna take down the police and make 'em kiss his fine ass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Plissken lets her go, stares...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... is perched ten feet off the ground on monster truck w Severed doll heads are glued all over the hood, and a lar glittering disco ball spins atop the roof, catching shard light and flicking them back into the night...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Behind the disco ball stands the real Cuervo Jones, at le there next to him is Utopia. She's dressed in black lace and bra, garters and stockings. A Playboy fantasy. She ho prototype. Delgado, Cuervo Jones' second-in-command, stan her. He is huge and evil. Dressed like Pancho Villa.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Plissken stares as the Cadillac passes. The hooker cheers with the rest of the crowd, and doesn't notice that Pliss moved off...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Several motorcycles bring up the rear of the caravan. Mes ride with their women slung behind them. As the last bike Plissken darts out of the alley, yanks the woman off the the cycle, jumps on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Mescalito biker turns to react...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHACK! Plissken takes him out with a head-butt, shoves hi bike, hops up on the seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KAVROOM! Plissken guns the motorcycle and it roars off, a other bikers, toward the head of the caravan. Plissken zo along, makes the turn onto La Brea Avenue with the carava

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the caravan turns west onto Sunset, Plissken blasts ar corner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coming right behind him are four Mescalitos on Harleys - iron bars, and swords in their hands. Plissken stares up

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... is just a few feet away. Cuervo Jones and Utopia.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Plissken guns it when suddenly two Mescalitos pull up on side of him. One of them swings a chain. Plissken grabs i one hand, and with his other hand, aims his submachine gu fires! The Mescalito and bike go flying, and Plissken hol the chain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Atop the Cadillac, Cuervo Jones reacts to the sound of gu turns to see...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the other Mescalito riding behind him swings a chain. swings his. The two chains snap together, intertwining. T Plissken squeezes his hand-brake. He screeches to a stop. Mescalito keeps going, and is yanked over backward by his chain, off the Harley. Finally the Harley flops over, ski explodes. Plissken guns it again, takes off after the Cad

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two more Mescalitos pull up on either side of Plissken. T aim at him with their automatic rifles. Plissken pulls a wheelie, lifts the front of his bike up into the air, rid back wheel. The two Mescalitos fire - directly into each They fall and their bikes go crashing to the pavement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Plissken surges the bike forward, coming up on a Mescalit horseback who turns and fires. Plissken ducks and the bul through the rear tire. The tire blows and the bike swerve control. Plissken leaps from the bike and grabs the back saddle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Plissken pulls himself up behind the Mescalito and wrestl control of the mount. Plissken grabs the reins and wraps around the Mescalito's neck, squeezing until his eyes bur Plissken slams his arm against the Mescalito, throwing hi saddle, bouncing onto the pavement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Plissken gallops ahead, circling a lasso high above his h pounding down on a biker. The lasso takes flight and find mark, the biker's neck. Plissken pulls the lasso taut, ti end to the saddle horn, rides his mount parallel to the b

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With one quick yank to the lasso, Plissken pulls the bike jumps on the bike and smacks the hell out of the horse's

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Takes off down the street, dragging the biker by the neck

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Speeds up as Plissken moves up to the Mustang five cars b swings off the bike and jumps onto the trunk. Plissken cl to the roof, leaps on the hood, then jumps to the trunk o in front - leapfrogging, jumping to the next car, the nex

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lean out their car windows, firing at him, but Plissken k moving toward the Cadillac...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reaches out a car window and grabs Plissken's submachine Plissken turns to snatch it back -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leaps from the Cadillac and takes Plissken down to the ro

dialogues.speaker: CUERVO JONES
dialogues.text: Snake Plissken.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They struggle. Cuervo raises his machete. Plissken grabs wrist, flips him over, knocks the machete off into the st smacks Cuervo in the face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Comes roaring up on his bike, throws the bolas...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the bolas hit him, wrap around his neck, the balls thu in the face, sending him flying...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KAWHAP! Plissken hits the pavement hard. He skids, rolls, last slams into the edge of the sidewalk. The caravan rum down Sunset. The hand in the car window still holds Pliss submachine gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cuervo crouches on the roof, hissing at Plissken.

dialogues.speaker: CUERVO JONES
dialogues.text: Later, Snake. We finish it later.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lies there for several beats, then climbs to his feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... disappears up Sunset.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stands alone in the deserted street. The ruins of a super cheap motels, liquor stores - all empty, desolate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks over to see the broken remains of his pocket wal After a beat, he starts moving up Sunset, checking his tw handguns, slipping them into their holsters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the border of Beverly Hills, Sunset stretches off into darkness beyond the intersection. A slight wind blows lit aimlessly along. There are occasional sounds: Creaks, dis clangs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Plissken approaches the intersection. He carries Utopia's homing device. It is silent. The small screen's blank. Th Plissken glances at his wrist watch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three hours gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Plissken stands for a moment, staring off down Sunset...

dialogues.speaker: VOICE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Snake Plissken, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He spins around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sits in an old beach chair on the sidewalk, a map to the sign in front of him. In his late 50's, he's a petty thie man. He's been hustling tourists and everybody else all h

dialogues.speaker: MAP TO THE STARS EDDIE
dialogues.text: Wow! Snake Plissken!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Map To The Stars Eddie listens to WAYWARD WIND by Gogi Gr small, metal-plated portable radio. He clicks off the rad rises, walks over to Plissken.

dialogues.speaker: MAP TO THE STARS EDDIE
dialogues.text: You're a star in your own right, you know that? Hey, I'm Map To The Stars Eddie. How you doin'?

dialogues.speaker: PLISSKEN
dialogues.text: Where'd they go?

dialogues.speaker: MAP TO THE STARS EDDIE
dialogues.text: Man, I'd love to have your autograph, Snake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He searches around in his pockets, comes up with pen and

dialogues.speaker: MAP TO THE STARS EDDIE
dialogues.text: I've been hearing about you ever since that New York deal back in the 90's. You're one smooth operator. (offers pen and paper) Could you sign one to Wolf, one to Death's Head, one to Slasher Smith...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Plissken grabs him by the throat.

dialogues.speaker: PLISSKEN
dialogues.text: Where are they?

dialogues.speaker: MAP TO THE STARS EDDIE
dialogues.text: Who? You mean Cuervo Jones? He's the man with the juice, Snake. Got the President's daughter. Setting up a citywide truce. Big doings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Plissken draws a 9mm and points it at Map To The Stars Ed forehead.

dialogues.speaker: PLISSKEN
dialogues.text: Location.

dialogues.speaker: MAP TO THE STARS EDDIE
dialogues.text: Cuervo's got a place near Venice, where the big birds fly. Nice digs, too. I've been there, y'know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Plissken releases him, as suddenly the tracer beeps. On t Plissken sees a small red pulsing dot. West.

dialogues.speaker: MAP TO THE STARS EDDIE
dialogues.text: Nice little gizmo you got there. (whispers conspiratorially) Look, Snake. I've got connections in this town. You need something, I'm your man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Without a word Plissken turns, walks away down Sunset Bou toward Beverly Hills.

dialogues.speaker: MAP TO THE STARS EDDIE
dialogues.text: Hey - you can't go there, Snake. You can't walk through Beverly Hills.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Plissken's figure disappears...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The old Beverly Hills sign. It's been painted over in dri letters: "QUIET - SURGICAL ZONE - STAY OUT"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Plissken ignores the sign, keeps walking down a completel Sunset Boulevard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Plissken walks past the once-beautiful mansions along Sun they are dark, ruined.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As a twisted, mechanical hand sewn awkwardly to the flesh wrist pulls aside a window curtain. The face behind the w in shadows, but we can just make out its pale, discolored features. The other hand brings up a walkie-talkie...

dialogues.speaker: SENTRY
dialogues.text: (into walkie) Specimen moving west on Sunset.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Plissken moves into the intersection of Sunset and Beverl The ruins of the old Beverly Hills Hotel are ahead and to right. He stops, stares down Sunset...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emerges from the shadows. This is the gatekeeper. Strange mismatched body parts. A black-skinned arm attached to a white body. His face is unnaturally smooth - too many fac He carries a torch.

dialogues.speaker: GATEKEEPER
dialogues.text: Halt! (beat) Where are you going? (no reply) Are you here for the auction?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Figures have suddenly moved out into the street, all with mismatched body parts - heads too large for their torsos, body parts mixed with male heads, all sewn together with uneven stitches. Plissken is surrounded.

dialogues.speaker: GATEKEEPER
dialogues.text: Welcome to Beverly Hills.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Plissken raises his gun, starts to move, when suddenly a rises behind him out of the shadows...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Raises a lead pipe, brings it down hard...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THUNK! He goes out like a light.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Plissken slumps unconscious to the street, the figures him. Their arms lock around him, drag him away with amazi - a pack of wolves on a deer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Plissken bolts awake, to find himself tied to a cross. It lurching back and forth as though the ground is moving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Plissken is being carried down Rodeo Driveon the cross by of surgical failures. They carry torches. Dressed in tatt Their faces look only partially human sewn together ragge

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rodeo Drive is a bizarre marketplace of body parts. The o beautiful storefronts of famous designers are now in sham Human body parts are on display like filets of fish on ic

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gucci now offers body pieces fashioned from spare car par Armani displays more eclectic, high priced pieces sewn to like sculptures in their windowfronts. A giant rift runs street's center. Acrid smoke rises.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The throng stops at an intersection, and Plissken's cross anchored in the middle of the street. Surrounding the int are patients of every size, age, sex.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Plissken looks over, sees another cross being carried up planted right next to his. A beautiful girl is tied to th This is TASLIMA, 20's, Iranian, the face of a Persian pri She's dressed in black leather, and basically has an IQ o 50.

dialogues.speaker: TASLIMA
dialogues.text: Hi, Snake. It's so great to meet you. My name's Taslima. I'm a fan of yours.

dialogues.speaker: PLISSKEN
dialogues.text: Are you crazy?

dialogues.speaker: TASLIMA
dialogues.text: A little bit. But pretty soon I'm gonna be dead. So are you, Snake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Plissken looks across the street. Our of the ruins of the famous red door of Elizabeth Arden come an arm of women f with acid-burned faces from one-too-many skin peelings wi knives, saws, horrible-looking carving instruments...

dialogues.speaker: TASLIMA
dialogues.text: I can't believe I got caught. (sighs) I run with Midnight Jihad. Iranian gang. Only they kicked me out, cause I screw up sometimes. I forget stuff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Plissken struggles with his bonds.

dialogues.speaker: TASLIMA
dialogues.text: I left my boyfriend's place tonight, took a wrong turn... (sighs again) Oh, Snake, I'm really kind of out of it sometimes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OUT OF THE RED DOOR come more interns and nurses carrying pans and pushing gurneys to collect dismembered body part

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The throng of facialists, patients, interns and nurses su Plissken and Taslima on the crosses. They move back to th sidewalks as the auction for body parts cut freshly from and Taslima is about to begin. The gurneys are wheeled in and set up as large cutting tables. The facialists take t positions behind the tables waiting to carve fresh meat.

dialogues.speaker: PLISSKEN
dialogues.text: What are they?

dialogues.speaker: TASLIMA
dialogues.text: They live here, used to be like us. But after too many silicon implants, their muscles turned to jelly. The only way they survive is to have body parts transplanted over and over again. (whispers) Snake, nobody who comes into Beverly Hills gets out alive.

dialogues.speaker: PLISSKEN
dialogues.text: No screamin' shit.

dialogues.speaker: TASLIMA
dialogues.text: Oh no, it's the Doctor.

dialogues.speaker: PLISSKEN
dialogues.text: Who?

dialogues.speaker: TASLIMA
dialogues.text: The Surgeon General of Beverly Hills.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steps out into the street. He appears incredibly gorgeous of a man, put together by the finest body parts available Beverly Hills - a millennium Fabio - but upon closer exam he's got no lower jaw. Instead, there is a rusting metal attached beneath each ear. It never moves. He can actuall through a metal box attached to his windpipe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stands in front of them. He raises his hands to quiet the He walks around the cross, admiring the beautiful bodies him. He tickles the fine flesh with his right hand, which up of 10 gleaming scalpels which form a 360 degree cuttin

dialogues.speaker: THE DOCTOR
dialogues.text: I've never seen more beautiful specimens. There will be no auction tonight. These body parts will go to those who need them the most.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The crowd gumbles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Turns his head sideways, to a small hidden pocket near hi With his teeth, he pulls out the silver mouth dart, slips his tongue, closes his mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The doctor raises his gleaming scalpel hand and steps tow Plissken.

dialogues.speaker: THE DOCTOR
dialogues.text: What a beautiful blue eye. It's a shame you only have one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A nurse brings over a small step-ladder. The doctor posit in front of Plissken, slowly climbs up the rungs until he to face with him. The doctor looks ready to pluck Plisske eye from its socket with his scalpel tips.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FFFTTT! Plissken spits the mouth dart!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHACK! The dark hits the doctor squarely in the forehead. freezes, his scalpel hand raised, his eyes clouding. He f forward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The scalpel hand swings, misses its mark, and instead hit rope tied around Plissken's wrist. WHATCK! The rope's cut

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Plissken grabs the scalpel hand with his free hand, cuts hand and legs loose in a flash and pushes the doctor back the step-ladder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHUMP! Plissken falls to the intersection, almost at the as the doctor hits the pavement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The patients are stunned. Motionless. They stare at their lying in the street, moaning, moving slightly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Snake starts to run...

dialogues.speaker: TASLIMA
dialogues.text: Snake, help me.

dialogues.speaker: SNAKE
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: TASLIMA
dialogues.text: I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Almost on a whim, Plissken cuts her free. Then he runs. T follows him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Plissken heads toward a side street, looks over his shoul Taslima following...

dialogues.speaker: PLISSKEN
dialogues.text: Don't follow me.

dialogues.speaker: TASLIMA
dialogues.text: You need help.

dialogues.speaker: PLISSKEN
dialogues.text: Like hell I do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then Plissken comes to a dead stop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Comes a mass of patients right at him. Taslima grabs Plis pulls him with her. They take off down a dark cobblestone street...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Plissken and Taslima run as behind them the patient horde chase. They stop at another small alley between two large buildings.

dialogues.speaker: TASLIMA
dialogues.text: Down this way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They disappear into the small alley.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's long and narrow and completely enclosed by the build either side. Suddenly Plissken and Taslima come to the en foot high four-story building blocking the passageway to

dialogues.speaker: PLISSKEN
dialogues.text: This is a dead end. (looks at her) You took us into a dead end!

dialogues.speaker: TASLIMA
dialogues.text: I just thought you wanted to get away. I didn't know you wanted to go someplace.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KACLANK! They turn...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The doctor staggers down the alley, the dart still sticki his forehead. Behind him, the patients follow...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Plissken shoves Taslima toward a broken window.

dialogues.speaker: PLISSKEN
dialogues.text: Go!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He follows Taslima through the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Plissken and Taslima climb dilapidated stairs, move along balcony railing. A torn and tattered Roy Lichtenstein pai hangs crooked on a wall. Twenty foot high bright red lett "CAA" - lie strewn across the marble floor. Various offic wrecked and dark, scripts lay all over the place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They stop at a dark hallway. Taslima moves cautiously ahe

dialogues.speaker: TASLIMA
dialogues.text: Be careful of the bald cats. They live in these buildings.

dialogues.speaker: PLISSKEN
dialogues.text: The what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Plissken reaches for his other 9mm in its holder, but his are trapped by the doctor's body. Closer and closer moves dagger toward Plissken's good eye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Taslima scrambles, picks up Plissken's 9mm, then stares a men.

dialogues.speaker: PLISSKEN
dialogues.text: (yelling) Are you gonna stand there? Give me the gun!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Taslima starts to hand it to him. Both Plissken and the d fight to reach it. Finally, it's in Plissken's grasp. He three times - each one hitting. The doctor shudders, roll

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Plissken gets to his feet. He blasts one more time for go measure, then follows Taslima down the hallway...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They come down a flight of stairs, stop at the rear door.

dialogues.speaker: PLISSKEN
dialogues.text: How do we get out of here?

dialogues.speaker: TASLIMA
dialogues.text: Sewers. Come on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She pushes open the door...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Plissken and Taslima run from the building, as a chorus o rises. Patients swarm around the building in pursuit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Taslima stops at a sewer grate in the street.

dialogues.speaker: TASLIMA
dialogues.text: Down there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Plissken lifts the grating. Taslima jumps in, followed by Plissken...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dim, greenish light. Plissken and Taslima begin running d sewer tunnel. Through the hole behind them drop patients, chase. Plissken and Taslima race through a half-filled st seeping with slime. They turn a corner into another tunne run smack into a horde of patients. Instantly, the patien overpower them. Hands reach out and drag them down...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, from down the tunnel comes an unearthly sound, whispery screech like a demon unleashed from the underwor gets louder and louder. The patients freeze, then begin s and, as the sound gets louder still, they all disappear, back down the tunnel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An eerie light appears, coming nearer and nearer every mo

dialogues.speaker: TASLIMA
dialogues.text: Snake - what is it?

dialogues.speaker: PLISSKEN
dialogues.text: How the hell am I supposed to know? This is your damn city.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Slowly, the light takes form. It is a single, gigantic ey floating in pitch-black darkness. It continues coming - g larger and larger. Suddenly the sewer begins to echo with blasting, ringing sound. Music!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's incredibly LOUD SALSA MUSIC!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From out of the tunnel drives an ancient golf cart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On a metal pole in front is a huge, lighted eye such as a optometrist might use to advertise his services. Salsa mu blares at top volume from loudspeakers strapped to the si the cart. At the wheel of the vehicle is a large man dres jeans, cowboy boots and a flak vest, wearing a gas mask. is hooked to his belt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pulls up near Plissken and Taslima, shuts off the moto music, lifts a shotgun from the seat beside him, climbs d holds the gun on them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Removing his head gear, his face becomes visible. He is P BOB, a Mexican wearing sunglasses under the gas mask. He the sunglasses, and his apparently blind in one eye. He l Los Lobos' lead guitarist.

dialogues.speaker: PENDEJO BOB
dialogues.text: What're you doing in here?

dialogues.speaker: PLISSKEN
dialogues.text: Looking to get out.

dialogues.speaker: PENDEJO BOB
dialogues.text: Good. I want you out. This is my sewer.

dialogues.speaker: PLISSKEN
dialogues.text: Which way?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With a grunt of curiosity, Pendejo Bob moves up to Plissk Suddenly his blind eye flashes on like a tiny, built-in s With it, he examines Plissken's face.

dialogues.speaker: PENDEJO BOB
dialogues.text: You're Snake Plissken.

dialogues.speaker: TASLIMA
dialogues.text: Yes. Isn't he cool?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is a clicking sound and the lighted eye is extingui Pendejo Bob extends his hand.

dialogues.speaker: PENDEJO BOB
dialogues.text: An honor, Snake. Amigo. They call me Pendejo Bob.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Plissken doesn't shake. From down the tunnel the shouts a footfalls of the patients gets closer...

dialogues.speaker: PENDEJO BOB
dialogues.text: Those damn patients are coming back. You'd better climb aboard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Plissken and Taslima climb into the rear of the golf cart Bob spins the cart, takes off in the other direction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The golf cart streaks along through a dark sewer passage. light comes from the eye on the front of the vehicle.

dialogues.speaker: PENDEJO BOB
dialogues.text: I use the eye and the music to scare em off. They're so whacked out, man, it works great. Chased a whole bunch of em right off the edge there a few months ago.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He points to a sheer, pitch-black drop-off on one side of passage.

dialogues.speaker: TASLIMA
dialogues.text: (she peers over the side) How far down does it go?

dialogues.speaker: PENDEJO BOB
dialogues.text: Don't know - never do hear em land. Earthquake opened it up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The golf cart creaks into a narrow tunnel...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guards, Hispanics in biker denims, fatigues, with rifles sunglasses, line the walls. They watch as the golf cart p ahead is a door marked: "SEWAGE RECLAMATION CONTROL"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cart pulls into the remains of a mammoth underground center. It's lined with ladders, catwalks, machines full and levers. A few are still working - most are broken and with dust and grime.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Filling the room is an underground enclave: Men, women, c all Hispanic, living in tents and lean-to's, cooking over fires next to old rusted cars on blocks, lots of weapons, sunglasses. Also, high-tech, futuristic rifles, cannons, launchers - an amazing arsenal. Crates of explosives are everywhere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The golf cart comes to a stop and they get off.

dialogues.speaker: PENDEJO BOB
dialogues.text: I own this whole place. Used to work here in the old days. I was right in this room when the big one hit. What a mess. We were waist high in shit. (turns proudly to them) Everybody else ran, but not me. I stayed at my post. Now it's all mine. I brought my whole family, my amigos, down here to live with me.

dialogues.speaker: TASLIMA
dialogues.text: Gun runners.

dialogues.speaker: PENDEJO BOB
dialogues.text: Hey, it's a living, baby.

dialogues.speaker: PLISSKEN
dialogues.text: Why don't you get out of L.A.? Take a boat to China, take an airplane to Brazil? (looks at Taslima) Earthquakes, death, shit. Why do you stay?

dialogues.speaker: TASLIMA
dialogues.text: I don't know. Somehow, I just can't leave.

dialogues.speaker: PENDEJO BOB
dialogues.text: Y'know, L.A.'s not such a bad place, Snake. We got our problems, sure - but this is paradise, man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pendejo Bob leans in close and whispers conspiratorially Plissken.

dialogues.speaker: PENDEJO BOB
dialogues.text: Say, you need anything, Snake? Guns? Explosives? I can get you a crate of hellfire grenades, no problem - five hours.

dialogues.speaker: PLISSKEN
dialogues.text: Yeah. So how do I get to Venice?

dialogues.speaker: PENDEJO BOB
dialogues.text: All the sewers are collapsed under Venice. You have to go topside. Right up there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He leads Plissken and Taslima to a ladder that goes up in darkness. A line of men steadily climb up, one after the carrying crates of weapons.

dialogues.speaker: PENDEJO BOB
dialogues.text: Comes out near the Santa Monica Freeway. Just follow the signs. Get off at the Lincoln Exit, turn left.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pendejo Bob interrupts the line of men. Plissken starts u ladder, followed by Taslima...

dialogues.speaker: PENDEJO BOB
dialogues.text: Nice to meet you, Snake. You too, Miss. You're welcome down here anytime. Anytime at all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Plissken, gun in hand, sticks his head out of the open gr Taslima follows. The Hispanic men who have climbed up out sewers load their weapons crates into various low-rider c heavily-armed groups. They rumble off into the night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Taslima points to a freeway on-ramp.

dialogues.speaker: TASLIMA
dialogues.text: The freeway's over there. But, Snake - I don't think it's such a good idea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Plissken starts toward the on-ramp. Taslima doesn't move.

dialogues.speaker: TASLIMA
dialogues.text: The freeways are dangerous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He keeps walking.

dialogues.speaker: TASLIMA
dialogues.text: Goodbye, Snake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Plissken stops, turns back, looks at her - a half-smile. close to 'thank you' as he gets.

dialogues.speaker: TASLIMA
dialogues.text: Sun's coming up in a few hours.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She walks up to him.

dialogues.speaker: TASLIMA
dialogues.text: UV's gonna be bad today. I have a friend who's got a place near here. We can crash there if you want, Snake. (she moves close to him) I'd love to take care of you. Make you feel good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Without an answer Plissken turns and walks away...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
